title: Auto-reconnect with different window size - Nightly 1.77.2
author: pauldurham
body_snippet:
If the PC is put into Sleep or Hibernation, when resuming and switching to mRemoteNG it attempts to reconnect to the host which it was connected to at the time of Sleep/Hibernate.  Once reconnected, the window size of the remote host is much smaller than it should be.  Signing out of the host & connecting again sorts out the issue.

## Expected Behavior
Reconnecting should result in a regular window size.

## Current Behavior
Reconnecting results in a much smaller window size.

## Steps ...

comments.snippet:
Did you try to then "not maximing"/restore down the window and maximizing it again? This usually triggers a resizing. A reconnect without logoff (right click tab name > Reconnect) should also trigger a resize.

But yes a wrong window size from the beginning is not ideal and should be looked at, similar to when a monitor is disconnected (see #2142).
